newsitem.title: UK: Barclays gains on Kleinwort upbeat stance.
newsitem.headline: Barclays gains on Kleinwort upbeat stance.

text.p: Shares in banking group Barclays Plc were higher on Wednesday, after analysts at Kleinwort Benson repeated their positive stance on the company in a research note yesterday.
The shares were up 13p at 989p by 0854 GMT.
In its latest review following the bank's presentation to fund managers, the broker was particularly impressed by the group's credit card business.
"Margins are robust and their credit card business is a growing part of the banking group," said on market source.
"Its (Barclaycard's) growth has been incredible and is probably underestimated."
Kleinwort expects the share price will reach 11.20-11.40 stg by the end of 1997 but the analysts did not upgrade their forecasts.
